pageContext.description: Christ's corpse rests on a white cloth and is supported by the people present. These appear to be the members of a donor family. Two coats-of-arms are shown in the bottom corners of the painting.

metadata.title: The Lamentation

pageContext.provenance:
- previously in the former Schlesische Museum der Bildenden Künste in Breslau, predecessor to the present-day Muzeum Narodowe we Wroclawiu
- in November 1945 evacuated from the Schlesische Museum der Bildenden Künste and taken to a storage facility in Kamenz, Poland
- end of February 1946, many works went missing including this painting
- eventually it ended up in Mariefred, where it belonged to Häggberg, a manager at the telecommunications company L M Ericsson
- 1970 purchased by the Nationamuseum [1]
- the Nationalmuseum will return the painting to Poland
[1] [Nationalmuseum Stockholm, revised 2011]

[The Art Newspaper from 23rd June 2020: https://www.theartnewspaper.com/news/nationalmuseum-in-stockholm-to-return-stolen-16th-century-painting-to-poland; accessed 18.08.2020]

tests.text: Identification of wood species: lime wood (Tilia sp.)
